title: Not so unique mode
body:
Hello
For a while now League of Legends have had these different game modes which reflect the brawl mode they have in Hearthstone. 
I have been thinking about a new game mode they could add:
I would call it "Not so unique". The idea with this is that the items that has "unique" abilities would be able to stack.
You could build 6 Bloodthirster and receive an incredible shield with you mighty 120% lifesteal XD
Or maybe you would become a giant with you Gargoyles Stoneplates or Sterak's Gage.
This would mean that all the boots passives would stack as well. I would open a shoe shop :3
Imagine the Redemption craziness XD.
Quote from Syndrome: "If everyone's super, no one is"

This would be insane. Imagine Hecarim stacking {{item:3742}} or Soraka stacking {{item:3504}} . Any assassin would be unkillable because they would just stack {{item:3812}} again and again and again for infinite healing. 4 Warmog's would mean instahealing as soon as you leave combat. Ryze could wield as many {{item:3003}}  as his blue heart desires. The real issue would be someone building 6 {{item:3089}} for a completely insane 1728 AP. You would have neither cooldown reduction, nor mana and a hellish early game build path but you would still be overtuned by the time you got 2 of them. In fact 5 {{item:3089}} and a {{item:3285}} would net you 1380 AP plus 600 mana and 20% cooldown reduction. Your Luden's charges would deal 238 damage. A Karthus ult would deal 1585 damage. Cho'gath would deal 1340 true damage with Feast not counting any bonus health.

Correction: 6 {{item:3089}} would stack to 2448 AP not 1728 AP. 5 and a Ludens would stack to 2070 AP
